fixes.name: Min Date
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR MinDate = MINX(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)',
    DATE(
        YEAR('Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE]),
        MONTH('Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE]),
        DAY('Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE])
    )
)
RETURN
MinDate
fixes.solution_explanation: Tableau's Min(date([EFFECTIVE_DATE])) converts the datetime to a date per row and then takes the minimum. In DAX this is implemented with MINX over the table, converting each row's datetime to a date using DATE(YEAR(...), MONTH(...), DAY(...)) before aggregation.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation uses an aggregation (MIN), so it must be implemented as a measure.
